fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In a story headlined Minister favours cull of badgers in TB fight (20 July, page 16), a sentence should have appeared in this form: "Trials have found that widespread culls can lead to an average 16% reduction of 'confirmed new incidence' of TB in herds." But the word "reduction" was dropped in the editing process. • We omitted to update an article prepared in advance, which said that a delayed white paper on public services reform was expected to be published in September. In the event, the white paper was published on 11 July (A plan for partnerships, 20 July, page 1, Reshaping services special supplement). • A still photo from the forthcoming film of The Inbetweeners showed Will, Simon, Neil and Jay wandering wide-eyed in a supposed Cretan party resort. The female actor pictured with them should have been named as Eloise Joseph, who plays a PR person, not Emma Louise Cargill, who plays a hotel guest (The not-bleeding-likely lads, 15 July, page 5, Film & music).
